alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 4:05AM EST until January 22 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Hatteras Island and Northern Outer Banks. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 4 PM EST this afternoon. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront may experience shallow flooding. Minor ocean overwash and beach erosion is possible and could impact portions of Hwy 12 on Hatteras Island during high tide. High tide is around 10 AM this morning. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Duck NC MLLW Categories - Minor 5.5 ft, Moderate 6.0 ft, Major 6.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.8 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 2.8 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 22/10 AM 5.6 1.9 2.3 7-8 Minor 22/10 PM 4.0 0.3 1.1 6 None 23/11 AM 3.9 0.2 0.8 4-5 None 23/11 PM 3.8 0.1 0.7 3 None 24/11 AM 3.7 0.0 0.9 4 None 25/12 AM 3.8 0.1 0.6 3 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
